info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 12:45PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF WEST CENTRAL SAN MIGUEL COUNTY THROUGH 115 PM MDT... At 1244 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Romeroville, or 8 miles southwest of Las Vegas, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Las Vegas, Romeroville, Tecolote, Ojitos Frios, San Geronimo, San Pablo and Los Montoyas. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 334 and 348. State Road 104 between Mile Markers 1 and 3. State Road 65 near Mile Marker 1. State Road 283 between Mile Markers 1 and 9. State Road 518 near Mile Marker 1. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor your preferred media outlets and NOAA Weather Radio for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
